trans-unit.source: Disables or enables encryption of the specified directory and the files in it

seg-source.mrk: Disables or enables encryption of the specified directory and the files in it

target.mrk: Disables or enables encryption of the specified directory and the files in it

trans-unit.source: The name of the directory for which to enable or disable encryption.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the directory for which to enable or disable encryption.

target.mrk: The name of the directory for which to enable or disable encryption.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter specifies a file, the attempt will fail.

target.mrk: If this parameter specifies a file, the attempt will fail.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to disable or enable encryption, valid values:

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

trans-unit.source: If encryption is disabled, the function will write the following to the Desktop.ini file in the directory (creating it if necessary):

target.mrk: If encryption is disabled, the function will write the following to the Desktop.ini file in the directory (creating it if necessary):

trans-unit.source: The user can also manually add or edit the above lines in the Desktop.ini file and produce the same effect.

seg-source.mrk: The user can also manually add or edit the above lines in the Desktop.ini file and produce the same effect.

target.mrk: The user can also manually add or edit the above lines in the Desktop.ini file and produce the same effect.

trans-unit.source: Thereafter, _WinAPI_EncryptFile() function will fail on the directory and the files in it, and the last error code will be ERROR_DIR_EFS_DISALLOWED (6010).

seg-source.mrk: Thereafter, _WinAPI_EncryptFile() function will fail on the directory and the files in it, and the last error code will be ERROR_DIR_EFS_DISALLOWED (6010).

target.mrk: Thereafter, _WinAPI_EncryptFile() function will fail on the directory and the files in it, and the last error code will be ERROR_DIR_EFS_DISALLOWED (6010).

trans-unit.source: This function does not affect encryption of subdirectories within the given directory.

seg-source.mrk: This function does not affect encryption of subdirectories within the given directory.

target.mrk: This function does not affect encryption of subdirectories within the given directory.
